sentences: Elizabeth Eden Harris (born May 31, 1997), known professionally as Cupcakke (often stylized as cupcakKe; pronounced ), is an American rapper, songwriter and record producer from Chicago, Illinois.
section: N/A

sentences: She is known for her hyper-sexualised, brazen, and often comical persona and music, and has also included themes such as gay rights, female empowerment, and autism awareness in her music.
section: N/A

sentences: Cupcakke began her career as a rapper by releasing material online in late 2012.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2015, two of her songs, "Deepthroat" and "Vagina", went viral on video-sharing platforms.
section: N/A

sentences: The songs were later included on her debut mixtape, Cum Cake (2016), which was included on Rolling Stone's list of the Best Rap Albums of 2016 at number 23.
section: N/A

sentences: Her second mixtape, S.T. D (Shelters to Deltas), was released in 2016 and preceded the studio albums Audacious (2016), Queen Elizabitch (2017), Ephorize (2018) and Eden (2018).
section: N/A

sentences: Since then, she has been steadily releasing standalone singles, such as "Grilling Niggas", "Lawd Jesus" and "Discounts".

== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Harris was born on May 31, 1997, in Chicago, Illinois, and was raised on King Drive, near Parkway Gardens.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Harris was raised by a single mother and spent nearly four years in Chicago's homeless shelters starting at age seven.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She grew up and went to school with other established Chicago rappers such as Lil Reese and Chief Keef.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She got an early start into music and poetry at the age of ten by her involvement in her local church.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: It was also there that she got her start in performing, where she would perform for her local pastors by reciting poetry about her Christianity and faith.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: When she was 13, she met a fellow church-goer who encouraged her to turn the poetry into rap music, and she became infatuated with the art form.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: She cites 50 Cent, Lil' Kim, and Da Brat as early influences to her musical style.
section: == Early life ==
